Summarise routes by grouping variables

summarise_routes.Rd

Groups routes by specified columns and creates route summaries, typically used for aggregating routes by origin-destination pairs.

Usage

summarise_routes(
  routes,
  id_route.col = "route_number",
  origin.col = "O",
  destination.col = "D",
  trips.col = names(routes)[grep("trip", names(routes))],
  attribute_trips = c("bicycle_godutch", "quietness", "gradient_smooth"),
  length.col = "length"
)

Arguments

routes

An sf object with route data

id_route.col

Column name for route ID. Default: "route_number"

origin.col

Column name for origin ID. Default: "O"

destination.col

Column name for destination ID. Default: "D"

trips.col

Column name for trip counts. Auto-detected by default.

attribute_trips

Attribute to include: "bicycle_godutch", "quietness", or "gradient_smooth"

length.col

Column name for route length. Default: "length"

Value

An sf object with summarized routes grouped by specified variables

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
route_summaries <- summarise_routes(routes_almada)
} # }
